text: a reader asked well what's the
difference between regular salt and sea
salt
table salt is mined from underground
salt beds and then refined sea salt
comes from the evaporation of seawater
and sea salts contain trace amounts of
minerals that are stripped from table
salt during the refining process table
salt has added iodine an essential
element for human nutrition as well as
man-made anti clumping agents but
despite these small differences experts
say there's no meaningful health benefit
to choosing one over the other both have
the same amount of sodium but there is a
difference in taste to add a course
crunchy texture and strong flavor to
your food use sea salt mark Bitterman
author of the book salted recommends
French grey sea salt or Himalayan sea
salt for everyday cooking and different
types of finishing salts like fleur de
sel good with eggs fish and cooked
vegetables flaky salts to top green
salads the hearty and moist grey salt
for meats and root vegetables and for a
culinary adventure try colorful salts
smoked salts or flavor infused salts
like chocolate or lemon salts and if
your doctor has told you to cut down on
salt ask if you can enjoy an occasional
- after all the main source of sodium in
the Western diet is not the salt shaker
or the sea but processed foods
you
